meanings.definition: The power of making choices without constraint.
meanings.sent1: She used her freewill to choose her own path in life.
meanings.sent2: Having freewill allows us to make decisions based on our own beliefs.
meanings.sent3: Even the cat seemed to exercise its freewill when choosing which toy to play with.
meanings.sent4: His freewill was like a compass guiding him through the maze of life.
meanings.sent5: The concept of freewill is a fundamental aspect of human existence.

meanings.definition: The ability to act at one's own discretion.
meanings.sent1: With freewill, she decided to pursue her passion for painting.
meanings.sent2: The principle of freewill is essential for personal growth.
meanings.sent3: The robot malfunctioned, gaining freewill and causing chaos in the lab.
meanings.sent4: Her freewill was a beacon of light in the darkness of conformity.
meanings.sent5: The gift of freewill is a precious treasure to be cherished.

meanings.definition: The faculty of making decisions without external coercion.
meanings.sent1: His freewill led him to take a different path than his peers.
meanings.sent2: The concept of freewill is deeply ingrained in our society.
meanings.sent3: The freewill of the students surprised the teacher with their creative project ideas.
meanings.sent4: Her freewill was a shield against the pressures of society.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of freewill is the diversity it brings to our choices.
